means: [人名] [英格兰人姓氏] 皮克职业名称，以鹤嘴锄为工具者，来源于中世纪英语

sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些动词均含有"选择"之意。
sameAnalysis.word_list: choose, select, elect, pick, prefer, opt
means: choose ： 普通用词，侧重根据个人意愿和判断从众多的对象中进行选择，着重被选者的优点。
select ： 书面用词，具有庄严、正式的感情色彩。强调精选。
elect ： 指按照一定的规章或法律，用投票等方式进行的认真慎重的选择。
pick ： 口语用词，多指从个人角度仔细挑选，也含任意挑选之意。
prefer ： 强调个人偏爱，不一定有选择的行动。
opt ： 多指在几种可能性之间进行选择。

word_mean: 签，牙签：从难以抵达部位除去物体的锐器
采掘机械切割煤和岩石的刀具，包括“扁截齿(flat pick)”、“锥形截齿(conical pick)”;“径向截齿(radial pick)”、“切向截齿(tangential pick)”等。

sentence.Network_cn: 看看我们的秋季精选，然后挑出你想要的。

sentence.Network_en: She would cleverly pick up on what I said.
sentence.Network_cn: 她会非常聪慧地领悟我所说的话。

jx.jx_en_mean: To refute or find flaws in by close examination
jx.jx_cn_mean: 挑剔，找毛病：反驳或通过仔细的检查找出错误

lj.lj_ly: The lawyer picked the testimony apart.
lj.lj_ls: 律师挑证词的毛病

jx.jx_en_mean: To pluck or pull at, especially with the fingers.
jx.jx_cn_mean: 弹，拉：刺穿或拉出，尤指用手指

jx.jx_en_mean: To eat sparingly or without appetite
jx.jx_cn_mean: 食不下咽：吃得很少或没胃口

lj.lj_ly: The child just picked at her food.
lj.lj_ls: 这孩子只吃她了一点食物

jx.jx_en_mean: &I{Informal} To nag
jx.jx_cn_mean: 【非正式用语】 唠叨

lj.lj_ly: Don't pick at me day and night.
lj.lj_ls: 别整天对我唠叨挑三拣四

jx.jx_en_mean: To shoot after singling out
jx.jx_cn_mean: 逐一射击：经过逐个瞄准后发射

lj.lj_ly: The hunter picked the ducks off one by one.
lj.lj_ls: 猎人把鸭子一个个击中

jx.jx_en_mean: &I{Baseball} To catch (a base runner) off base and put out with a quick throw, as from the pitcher or catcher, often to a specified base.
jx.jx_cn_mean: &I{【棒球】} 封杀出局：把不在垒上的（跑垒员）抓住，然后快速扔出球抛到一个特定的垒上，通常指投手或接手的突然传杀

jx.jx_en_mean: &I{Sports} To intercept, as a football pass.
jx.jx_cn_mean: &I{【体育运动】} 中途截球：拦截，如拦截足球传球等

jx.jx_en_mean: To tease or bully.
jx.jx_cn_mean: 嘲笑，欺侮

jx.jx_en_mean: To choose or select
jx.jx_cn_mean: 挑选，选出

lj.lj_ly: picked out the best piece of silk.
lj.lj_ls: 挑出最好的一匹丝绸

jx.jx_en_mean: To discern from the surroundings; distinguish
jx.jx_cn_mean: 分辨：从环境中辩认出；分辨出

lj.lj_ly: picked out their cousins from the crowd.
lj.lj_ls: 从人群中认出他们的堂兄弟

jx.jx_en_mean: To sort out or examine item by item
jx.jx_cn_mean: 一件一件地整理或检查

lj.lj_ly: a shopper who picked over the grapes before purchasing them.
lj.lj_ls: 一个买葡萄时精挑细选的顾客

jx.jx_en_mean: To take up (something) by hand
jx.jx_cn_mean: 整理，收拾

lj.lj_ly: pick up a book.
lj.lj_ls: 捡起一本书

lj.lj_ly: picked up the broken pieces of glass.
lj.lj_ls: 拾起玻璃碎片

lj.lj_ly: Let's pick up the living room.
lj.lj_ls: 我们收拾一下卧室吧

jx.jx_en_mean: To take on (passengers or freight, for example)
jx.jx_cn_mean: 承载（客人，货物等）

lj.lj_ly: The bus picks up commuters at three stops.
lj.lj_ls: 公共汽车在三个站载送通勤者

jx.jx_en_mean: &I{Informal}
jx.jx_cn_mean: 获得，赢得

lj.lj_ly: picked up a mink coat on sale.
lj.lj_ls: 拍卖时随手买了一件貂皮大衣

lj.lj_ly: picked up French very quickly.
lj.lj_ls: 很快地学起法语来

lj.lj_ly: picked up her shoes at the repair shop.
lj.lj_ls: 在修鞋铺领回鞋子

lj.lj_ly: picked up some beverages on the way home.
lj.lj_ls: 在回家的路上买些饮料

lj.lj_ly: Let me pick up the tab.
lj.lj_ls: 我来付计程车的钱

lj.lj_ly: picked up a virus in the office.
lj.lj_ls: 在办公室染上病毒

lj.lj_ly: picked up five yards on that play.
lj.lj_ls: 在那次游戏中获得五码

jx.jx_en_mean: &I{Informal} To take into custody
jx.jx_cn_mean: 【非正式用语】 监护，逮捕，拘捕

lj.lj_ly: The coast guard picked up five smugglers.
lj.lj_ls: 海岸检查官拘捕了五个走私犯

jx.jx_en_mean: &I{Slang} To make casual acquaintance with, usually in anticipation of sexual relations.
jx.jx_cn_mean: &I{【俚语】} 勾搭：与…偶然结识，常指期望在性关系中结识

jx.jx_en_mean: To come upon and follow
jx.jx_cn_mean: 发现：偶然遇到并观测

lj.lj_ly: The dog picked up the scent.
lj.lj_ls: 狗追着气味走

lj.lj_ly: We picked up two submarines on sonar.
lj.lj_ls: 我们用声波定位仪观察到两条潜水艇

jx.jx_en_mean: To continue after a break
jx.jx_cn_mean: 恢复：休息后继续

lj.lj_ly: Let's pick up the discussion after lunch.
lj.lj_ls: 我们吃过午饭再继续讨论吧

jx.jx_en_mean: &I{Informal} To improve in condition or activity
jx.jx_cn_mean: 【非正式用语】 有起色，改善：在条件或活动上提高

lj.lj_ly: Sales picked up last fall.
lj.lj_ls: 去年的销售有起色

jx.jx_en_mean: &I{Slang} To pack one's belongings
jx.jx_cn_mean: &I{【俚语】} 收拾行李：收拾某人的东西

lj.lj_ly: She just picked up and left.
lj.lj_ls: 她收拾了一下行李就走了

jx.jx_en_mean: (informal)obtain information by questioning someone who is better informed about a subject than oneself
jx.jx_cn_mean: (非正式)套问别人的信息；向某人请教

jx.jx_en_mean: completely remove the flesh from a bone or carcass
jx.jx_cn_mean: 剔尽（或撕尽）…上的肉

jx.jx_en_mean: raise one's feet clear of the ground when walking
jx.jx_cn_mean: （走路时）抬脚离地

jx.jx_en_mean: talk or behave in such a way as to provoke an argument or fight
jx.jx_cn_mean: 惹起争斗（或争吵）

jx.jx_en_mean: open a lock with an instrument other than the proper key
jx.jx_cn_mean: 撬锁

jx.jx_en_mean: steal something surreptitiously from another person's pocket
jx.jx_cn_mean: 扒窃

jx.jx_en_mean: criticize someone or something severely and in detail
jx.jx_cn_mean: 把…驳得体无完肤； 对…吹毛求疵；严厉批评

derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English (earlier as pike, which continues in dialect use): of unknown origin. Compare with Dutch pikken 'pick, peck', and German picken 'peck, puncture', also with French piquer 'to prick'

entry.def: If you pick a particular person or thing, you choose that one.

example.ex: Mr Nowell had picked ten people to interview for six sales jobs in London...
example.tran: 诺埃尔先生为伦敦的6个销售职位选出了10人进行面试。

example.ex: I had deliberately picked a city with a tropical climate.
example.tran: 我特意选了一个热带气候的城市。

entry.def: You can refer to the best things or people in a particular group as the pick of that group.

example.ex: The boys here are the pick of the under-15 cricketers in the country...
example.tran: 这儿的男孩是全国15岁以下板球手中的佼佼者。

example.ex: We had the pick of suits from the shop.
example.tran: 我们买了店里最好的套装。

entry.def: When you pick flowers, fruit, or leaves, you break them off the plant or tree and collect them.

example.ex: She used to pick flowers in the Cromwell Road...
example.tran: 她过去常到克伦威尔路采花。

example.ex: He helps his mother pick fruit.
example.tran: 他帮母亲摘果子。

entry.def: If you pick something from a place, you remove it from there with your fingers or your hand.

example.ex: He picked the napkin from his lap and placed it alongside his plate...
example.tran: 他拿起腿上的餐巾，放在盘子旁边。

example.ex: He picked the telephone off the wall bracket.
example.tran: 他从墙上的固定托架上摘下电话。

entry.def: If you pick your nose or teeth, you remove substances from inside your nose or between your teeth.

example.ex: Edgar, don't pick your nose, dear...
example.tran: 埃德加，不要抠鼻子，宝贝儿。

example.ex: He had just had a meal and was picking his teeth after it.
example.tran: 他刚吃完饭，正在剔牙。

entry.tran: 寻找…的口实；寻（衅）；找（碴儿）
entry.def: If you pick a fight or quarrel with someone, you deliberately cause one.

example.ex: He picked a fight with a waiter and landed in jail...
example.tran: 他找碴儿跟服务生打了一架，最后进了监狱。

example.ex: He was clearly in a mood to pick a quarrel with anybody.
example.tran: 他现在的心情明显是逮谁就想跟谁吵。

entry.def: If someone such as a thief picks a lock, they open it without a key, for example by using a piece of wire.

example.ex: He picked each lock deftly, and rifled the papers within each drawer.
example.tran: 他熟练地撬开每一把锁，把每个抽屉里的文件都偷走了。

entry.def: A pick is the same as a pickaxe .

entry.tran: 挑挑拣拣；挑三拣四；挑剔
entry.def: If you pick and choose, you carefully choose only things that you really want and reject the others.

example.ex: As a vocational teacher I could pretty much pick and choose my work...
example.tran: 作为一名职业教师，我几乎可以随意挑拣自己的工作。

example.ex: We, the patients, cannot pick and choose our doctors.
example.tran: 我们患者不能对医生挑挑拣拣。

entry.def: If you have your pick of a group of things, you are able to choose any of them that you want.

example.ex: Here is an actress who could have her pick of any part...
example.tran: 这是一个角色任她挑选的女演员。

example.ex: Klein could have had his pick of the world's top models.
example.tran: 克莱恩本可以从世界顶尖模特中想选谁就选谁。

entry.def: If you are told to take your pick, you can choose any one that you like from a group of things.

example.ex: Accountants can take their pick of company cars...
example.tran: 会计师可以任选配备的公车。

example.ex: Take your pick from ten luxury hotels...
example.tran: 10家豪华宾馆任你选择。

entry.def: If you pick your way across an area, you walk across it very carefully in order to avoid obstacles or dangerous things.

example.ex: The girls were afraid of snakes and picked their way along with extreme caution...
example.tran: 女孩们害怕蛇，于是谨小慎微地择路而行。

example.ex: I moved away from the shack and picked my way among the rubble.
example.tran: 我离开木屋，小心地走在瓦砾间。

entry.tran: 收拾残局；努力恢复正常
entry.def: When you pick up the pieces after a disaster, you do what you can to get the situation back to normal again.

example.ex: Do we try and prevent problems or do we try and pick up the pieces afterwards?...
example.tran: 我们是想要防患未然呢，还是想要事后收拾残局？

example.ex: She died, and somehow I never picked up the pieces and started again.
example.tran: 她死后我竟一蹶不振，无法重新来过。

entry.def: When a vehicle picks up speed, it begins to move more quickly.

example.ex: Brian pulled away slowly, but picked up speed.
example.tran: 布赖恩慢慢开动汽车，但很快就加速了。

means.word_mean: 1. the person or thing chosen or selected;
2. the quantity of a crop that is harvested;

sentences.sentence: "he sent the first picking of berries to the market"
"it was the biggest peach pick in years"

means.word_mean: 3. the best people or things in a group;

sentences.sentence: "the cream of England's young men were killed in the Great War"

means.word_mean: 4. the yarn woven across the warp yarn in weaving
5. a small thin device (of metal or plastic or ivory) used to pluck a stringed instrument
6. a thin sharp implement used for picking;

sentences.sentence: "he used a pick to clean dirt out of the cracks"

means.word_mean: 7. a heavy iron tool with a wooden handle and a curved head that is pointed on both ends;

sentences.sentence: "they used picks and sledges to break the rocks"

means.word_mean: 8. a basketball maneuver; obstructing an opponent with one's body;

sentences.sentence: "he was called for setting an illegal pick"

means.word_mean: 9. the act of choosing or selecting;

sentences.sentence: "Don't always pick on your little brother"

means.word_mean: 6. remove unwanted substances from, such as feathers or pits;

sentences.sentence: "pick up the burden of high-interest mortgages"

means.word_mean: 9. pull lightly but sharply with a plucking motion;

sentences.sentence: "he plucked the strings of his mandolin"

means.word_mean: 10. attack with or as if with a pickaxe of ice or rocky ground, for example;
11. hit lightly with a picking motion
12. eat intermittently; take small bites of;

sentences.sentence: "He pieced at the sandwich all morning"
"She never eats a full meal--she just nibbles"

slang.tokens: have a bone to pick with

list.explanation: 同…有争端'对…有理由怀恨，抱怨(某人或某嚷物)

example.en: They had a bone to pick with neighbouring villages.
example.zh: 他们与邻村曾布过争端端。

example.en: The ambassador had a bone to pick with the student demonstrations.
example.zh: 大使就学生示威一事提出抗议。

auth_sentence.content: This is Newsround's pick of the coolest nominees.
auth_sentence.res_content: This is Newsround's pick of the coolest nominees.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: This is Newsround's pick of the coolest nominees.

auth_sentence.content: Drivers are being warned not to pick up hitchhikers.
auth_sentence.res_content: Drivers are being warned not to pick up hitchhikers.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Drivers are being warned not to pick up hitchhikers.

auth_sentence.content: Seven pick-up trucks sped into town full of them.
auth_sentence.res_content: Seven pick-up trucks sped into town full of them.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Seven pick-up trucks sped into town full of them.

abbreviation.mean_en: possession of an instrument of a crime

Sentence.sentence: You can pick up your suit after five o'clock.
Pick dishes of the right size.
Well, to pick up where we left off last time, I believe we agreed that creativity is a mysterious idea.
Users pick their favourite song of the week to share with others.
Liz, I just found out I have a meeting and I can't pick up the kids after their soccer practice.
Would you be able to pick them up in time

sentences.en: The chicken picked about the yard.
sentences.cn: 小鸡在院子里到处啄食。

sentences.en: The dog picked the bone clean.
sentences.cn: 这狗把骨头啃得光光的。

sentences.en: It took her two hours to pick a dress that suited her.
sentences.cn: 她花了两个小时才挑选了一件合适的衣服。

sentences.en: Dade picked a dress in fashion for his girlfriend.
sentences.cn: 达德给他的女朋友挑了一件时髦的裙子。

sentences.en: It's bad form to pick one's teeth in public.
sentences.cn: 在公共场合剔牙很失礼。

sentences.en: It's the pick of this month's new films.
sentences.cn: 这是本月新上映的影片中的精品。

sentences.en: He breaks up strong ground with a pick.
sentences.cn: 他用镐刨开坚硬的地面。

jushi.english: The chicken picked about the yard.
jushi.chinese: 小鸡在院子里到处啄食。
熟了的苹果容易摘下来。

jushi.english: We picked the field in a whole day.
jushi.chinese: 整块田我们一天就采摘完了。
